name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"3027dc64-52a4-4ed3-943f-414cb30ac6fd","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Class Documentation: ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"NodeManager","styles":{"code":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2a8643f8-b331-4abd-b635-7f84b2307767","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"NodeManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" class acts as a central repository that links abstract namespaces to their physical locations in the source code's Abstract Syntax Tree (AST). In a large-scale analysis, the system needs a way to "jump" back to the definition of a function or class whenever it is referenced or called. This class provides that lookup mechanism.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5c253c76-130a-4ac2-81e5-01240175ea14","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"a46d30fa-dc87-4a1a-898b-3228dc08fe09","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Attributes","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9995b962-8399-46a5-81cf-c62b85fa8b86","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"nodes","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"dict","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"): The internal registry where keys are namespace strings (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":""module.submodule.FunctionName"","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") and values are the corresponding AST node objects.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f30f5ed5-1af2-4c48-b7e2-9ab782ff148f","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"3f95086d-7a3c-442b-903a-2aab4aa985cd","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Methods","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2d8d0986-94ee-473f-b521-1ce8a585c76c","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"__init__()
","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Initializes the manager with an empty dictionary. This instance is typically shared across the analysis lifecycle to maintain a global map of code structures.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6b516653-baa7-4cf0-b8ba-8bb5efc0ebb2","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"add(ns, node)
","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Registers a node under a unique namespace identifier.","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"8cd47175-083b-46ca-8d89-86ce3093e931","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"ns","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The full namespace path of the code structure.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8feac1be-7821-4975-825d-2cca5bad1aab","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"node","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The AST node object (e.g., a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"FunctionDef","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ClassDef","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" node).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4b69d0a0-8003-4b95-aaf0-1ba56aff2abd","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":": If the namespace already exists in the registry, the method returns immediately without overwriting the existing node. This ensures that the first discovered definition is treated as the canonical source.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"6c3a5739-5256-4784-97c7-aa29a6e673cc","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"get(ns)
","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Retrieves the previously stored AST node for a given namespace.","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"c608abae-a0c3-4165-9ea9-1462027834c2","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Returns the node object if found.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"405b1b4e-7aa2-4260-8be9-9befb0543093","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Returns ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"None","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" if the namespace has not been registered.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"da319fd7-8977-4f06-828c-dbb730a1798a","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"0fafd503-7112-4793-8d28-01a3397c030f","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Usage Example","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"88613161-d72f-47a8-b4d4-6154732bb8c0","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"NodeManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is primarily used to facilitate "Jump to Definition" logic during analysis.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bdd786cc-d676-4055-97c0-12902f1d6715","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"# 1. Setup the manager
node_manager = NodeManager()

# 2. During the first pass, register a function definition
# 'node_from_ast' would be an actual AST object parsed from the file
node_manager.add("app.utils.validate_user", node_from_ast)

# 3. Later, when the analyzer encounters a call to 'validate_user'
# it can retrieve the original node to analyze the function's body
target_node = node_manager.get("app.utils.validate_user")

if target_node:
    print("Definition found. Proceeding with function body analysis...")
else:
    print("Definition unknown. Skipping call resolution.")","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"61995bb8-2e30-4a5c-bc4a-6b6995c1b154","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Insights","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c76cbe4d-1d82-4544-bcbd-add72589ac13","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Idempotency","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"add","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method's check for existing keys ensures the stability of the model. In Python environments where a function might be imported or referenced in multiple places, the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"NodeManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" keeps a single source of truth for each unique namespace.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6c26a3f4-895f-4e7f-acf8-6d3812917d82","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Bridge to AST","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": This class is the primary link between the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"logical model","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (namespaces/strings) and the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"physical model","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (AST nodes/code). It allows Jarvis to move from a high-level symbol back down to the specific source code lines for deep inspection.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"782fa43f-c0a0-4e2c-b4bf-110d4b7e6bd4","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Centralization","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": By keeping all nodes in one registry, the system avoids redundant parsing of the same files, significantly improving performance during project-wide scans.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ec6af58a-92aa-4147-8812-eb971477c0d1","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
